content: everyone why lock here welcome back this
is pretty cool total vanity moment I'm a miniature now
and so were the other four guild masters so the story goes that some of our
crafting community members who live in Greece got together and started a gaming
company crippled God foundry they do all the sculpting molding and casting
in-house they use all the right advanced techniques vacuum and pressure casting
high quality resident the whole shebang so what's going on right now what I'm
about to show you is they're gonna do forty numbered copies it's a limited run
of these box sets of the five guild masters of the tabletop crafters guild
price will be 60 euros plus shipping and even if you have no interest go to their
website subscribe to their newsletter very cool up-and-coming company and note
that they have a Kickstarter coming at the end of April April 30th for a line
of undead themed miniatures so this would be an interesting experience I'm
gonna go ahead and unbox this limited-edition set and then paint
myself it is a handsome box and I'm not just trying to fill time and say nice
things there's something to be said for presentation I appreciate that so very
nice remove the packing foam here's an insert with a picture of whole bunch of
their products laid out in a beautiful display a little more depth into their
story and what's this cool little scroll here with actual twine you unroll it and
you'll see the five miniatures that are in this box there we are as well as
which number it is not but one I have here is that I believe a promo or a
prototype whatever so this isn't one of the 40 and going into here there's just
all five of us are here there's me v Gareth Jeremy and of course Scotty nice
and they even put the logos and the bases that's so neat okay I love you
guys but we're gonna focus on me here so let's crack this open there's a card
inside of a little higher resolution picture of what you're gonna be painting
and the crippled god logo on the back sharp alright easy there's no sprue it's
just the body and two arms and the base get out some super glue
I prefer gel control super glue either Loctite or gorilla both have worked
great for me on plastic resin and metal so we'll just apply a tiny little
a bit and pop it on there same thing for the other arm and I'm not going to
attach the bass right now because I'm gonna paint it separately and then
probably pin the feet on last and here it is close-up I would give the detail a
9 out of 10 excellent so I'm going to base coat this and white with my
airbrush I did not spray prime it I usually don't prime my miniatures 400 or
so of them have never had any durability issues your mileage may vary crippled
God does recommend priming these but in any event going with white doing white
on the base here because those letters need to be white and it's gonna be a lot
easier than getting a brush down there and as for me I just went ahead and
based in white I found lately I've been basing stuff in white because the colors
come out more vivid and I'm really liking tabletop I guess it's because I'm
filming things in it it films better when it's vibrant from there I just
started blocking in colors like this plate male remember to thin down your
paints to thin coats nice fine tip on the brush and I just blocked it in got
my base colors down yep so here it is doesn't look like much right now by the
way that magic blue that's the color from Vallejo that is the best blue I
have ever used from here I'm gonna wash this is a army
painter flesh wash awesome awesome color I'm just going to apply this
systematically with a fine tip here it is with all the washes applied black
wash over silver blue wash over blue flesh tone over the flesh and so on used
a Drax earth shade for the Browns wish they'd stayed looking this good when
wash is dry they tend to mute a lot one thing I've learned is don't be afraid to
let it pool in cloaks and capes it'll create that depth for you
for the logo I combined the two the old-school original black and white with
the purplish from the star filled in the current logo so from there I'm just
gonna use some tiny dabs of super glue and attach him I didn't bother pinning
the feet since this one must be a showpiece so that's a fun little 30
minute speed paint I did go back into a couple quick edge highlights with some
pure silver so you can see the detail on the model is great does a lot of work
for you the faces are usually a giveaway from me if the model doesn't have a
detailed face the rest of it usually isn't great so I raised a frosty one to
crippled God foundry everyone go and check them out I am why lock thanks for
joining me and I'll see you next time
